About
About
Turning societal challenges into tangible, impactful solutions is what drives me. Whether it is sustainable agriculture, ecosystem restoration, or combatting food waste — my interests are broad, but always rooted in purpose. I thrive in organisations and businesses with a sustainable mission.
I enjoy translating complex challenges into clear, pragmatic solutions, bridging the gap between technology and the people it serves. I am energized by bringing people together — aligning teams, improving collaboration between stakeholders, and coaching colleagues to grow. You can count on me to help deliver projects efficiently and with care.

Project manager & Coordinator Innovation Team
Project manager & Coordinator Innovation Team
FarmTree B.V. · Full-time
FarmTree B.V. · Full-time
Apr 2022 - Mar 2025 · 3 yrs
Apr 2022 to Mar 2025 · 3 yrs
Wageningen, Gelderland, Netherlands
Wageningen, Gelderland, Netherlands
FarmTree B.V. quantifies and forecasts the performance of Agroforestry systems using the The FarmTree Tool and Model. 
At FarmTree, I managed consultancy projects and SaaS implementations, overseeing planning, budgeting, and coordination to support sustainable agriculture initiatives—including carbon sequestration, sustainable value chains, and landscape restoration. I coordinated a diverse international team of project implementers, ensuring smooth communication and timely delivery. I also led sales efforts and provided proactive SaaS client support to strengthen customer relationships and satisfaction. Additionally, I collaborated closely with the IT team to develop the FarmTree Tool and Model. I supported senior management with strategic decision-making, contributing to business growth and mission alignment.

Learn more about FarmTree on www.farmtree.earth

Product Owner & Client Success Manager
Product Owner & Client Success Manager
Progreso Foundation
Progreso Foundation
Mar 2017 - Mar 2022 · 5 yrs 1 mo
Mar 2017 to Mar 2022 · 5 yrs 1 mo
Amsterdam, The Netherlands
Amsterdam, The Netherlands
Progreso supports coffee and cocoa producer organizations with their professional and sustainable development. 
As Product Owner, I led the development of Progreso’s coffee trading platform, Beyco, and the Farmer Data Collection app. I designed and implemented monitoring and evaluation tools, including living income assessments and farm-level impact analyses. Throughout my time at Progreso, I maintained strong client relationships and provided training on both platforms to coffee and cacao producers—delivered online and on-site across Africa and Latin America.

Discover more at www.progreso.nl and join a transparent coffee supply chain at www.beyco.nl.

Prince Bernhard Nature Fund (PBNF)
Prince Bernhard Nature Fund (PBNF)
Aug 2017 - Nov 2017 · 4 mos
Aug 2017 to Nov 2017 · 4 mos
Amsterdam Area, Netherlands
Amsterdam Area, Netherlands
The Prince Bernhard Nature Fund supports grassroots organizations worldwide with their conservation projects. 
During the Managing Director’s maternity leave, I temporarily managed the fund’s day-to-day operations. This included all communication with external partners and grant applicants, overseeing administrative processes, and reviewing and selecting incoming grant applications.

More information: www.pbnf.nl

Research Project: Sustainable harvesting of the understorey palm Geonoma baculifera
Research Project: Sustainable harvesting of the understorey palm Geonoma baculifera
Amazon Conservation Team and Utrecht University
Amazon Conservation Team and Utrecht University
May 2016 - Jan 2017 · 9 mos
May 2016 to Jan 2017 · 9 mos
Kwamalasamutu, Suriname and Utrecht, The Netherlands
Kwamalasamutu, Suriname and Utrecht, The Netherlands
Research project on sustainable harvesting of the understorey palm Geonoma baculifera, that indigenous people use for roof thatching. Due to increased exploitation of this natural resource, the palm species is declining in the region of Kwamalasamutu, southern Suriname. Sustainable harvesting methods for this understorey palm will not only benefit the palm populations but also the people of Kwamalasamutu and the surrounding natural forest. For data collection I spent 3 months in Kwamalasamutu. This research project was part of the Twinning project between the Amazon Conservation Team and Utrecht University.

Co-Founder Conservation Connect & Director PBNF
Co-Founder Conservation Connect & Director PBNF
November 17, 2017, Anne managed Steffie directly
November 17, 2017, Anne managed Steffie directly
Steffie took over the current affairs of the Prince Bernhard Nature Fund (PBNF) during my maternity leave. She managed everything with great care and proved to be very professional and reliable. She can work independently but is also a nice person to work together with. She makes good use of her ecological background and is very accurate. I felt totally at ease with her handling the Fund's applications and communications in my absence. She did a great job.
